title: Interactive plotting
text: PSRC Poppins font needs installed first start creating charts built R. following function install PSRC fonts. function names PSRC plot naming convention first identifies whether plot static interactive, type chart. example, static_bar_chart() makes static chart horizontal bars.
code: install_psrc_fonts()

what: Mak an interactive column chart of travel survey data
title: Interactive plotting
text: want create interactive column plot, call function interactive_column_chart specifying t underlying table. Note column chart x variable expected categories, y variable canumeric- since x values categories numeric values represented y axis. example , read example data table shows transit access modes travel survey: data table sent interactive column chart PSRC colors following function: can find functions running ?function_name package. example, ?interactive_column_chart()
code: transit_acc_df<- read.csv(system.file('extdata', 'transit_access.csv', package='psrcplot'))   transit_acc_df ##      survey     mode_acc_walk     count count_moe     share share_moe ## 1 2017_2019 Other Access Mode  76864.68  19849.31 0.1428148 0.0345003 ## 2 2017_2019  Walked or jogged 461347.49  49535.06 0.8571852 0.0345003 ## 3      2021 Other Access Mode  95813.72  26434.51 0.2464731 0.0604748 ## 4      2021  Walked or jogged 292925.31  36395.11 0.7535269 0.0604748 ##   sample_size      year ## 1         334 2017/2019 ## 2        4144 2017/2019 ## 3          78      2021 ## 4         297      2021 # Interactive chart         transit_access_chart<-interactive_column_chart(t=transit_acc_df,                                                 x='mode_acc_walk', y='share', fill='year',                                                 moe='share_moe', est='percent',                                                color="psrc_light", title='Transit Access Mode') transit_access_chart

title: Interactive plotting
text: can save interactive bar chart created programmatically using htmlwidgets library. html version file can embedded webpage.
code: library(htmlwidgets) ## Warning: package 'htmlwidgets' was built under R version 4.2.2 saveWidget(transit_access_chart,             file=('transit_access.html'))

title: Interactive plotting
text: psrcplot, provide many color ramps approved graphics department. color ramps can used referencing names color=“pgnobgy_5” . can see colors R following function: print_psrc_palette().
code: print_psrc_palette()

title: Get Started Making a Static Plot
text: PSRC Poppins font needs installed first start creating charts built R. following function install PSRC fonts. function names PSRC plot naming convention first identifies whether plot static interactive, type chart. example, interactive_column_chart makes interactive chart can displayed web vertical bars.
code: install_psrc_fonts()

what: Make a static bar plot of Census data
title: Get Started Making a Static Plot
text: want create bar plot, call function static_bar_chart specifying t underlying table. Note static_bar_chart x variable expected numeric, y variable categorical- since numeric values represented x axis y values categories. example , read example data table shows mode share race region: data table sent static_bar_chart PSRC colors following function: can find functions running ?function_name package. example, ?static_bar_chart()
code: mode_shares <- read.csv(system.file('extdata', 'example_data.csv', package='psrcplot')) %>%   filter(Category=="Mode to Work by Race") %>%  filter(Geography=="Region" & Race=="Total") %>%  mutate(Year = as.character(Year)) mode_shares ##    Year Geography  Race   count count_moe       share    share_moe ## 1  2010    Region Total  403369 10836.103 0.711037977 0.0138130361 ## 2  2010    Region Total   55723  6004.193 0.098225618 0.0102303583 ## 3  2010    Region Total   70898  5562.850 0.124975322 0.0096255011 ## 4  2010    Region Total   32929  3189.047 0.058045535 0.0056401605 ## 5  2010    Region Total    4314  1340.329 0.007604496 0.0023254157 ## 6  2015    Region Total 1577787 15808.465 0.785575621 0.0061570136 ## 7  2015    Region Total  109617  7425.106 0.054577990 0.0036083656 ## 8  2015    Region Total  187841  8902.649 0.093525495 0.0043774057 ## 9  2015    Region Total  117189  7840.840 0.058348067 0.0037042782 ## 10 2015    Region Total   14338  2309.254 0.007138849 0.0011428535 ## 11 2020    Region Total 1620547  8688.810 0.750594831 0.0027689638 ## 12 2020    Region Total  105416  3288.144 0.048825924 0.0014903525 ## 13 2020    Region Total  198435  4574.825 0.091909883 0.0020960216 ## 14 2020    Region Total  217592  4550.691 0.100782903 0.0021255052 ## 15 2020    Region Total   17027  1401.342 0.007886459 0.0006464336 ##                Category           Mode ## 1  Mode to Work by Race           Auto ## 2  Mode to Work by Race   Bike or Walk ## 3  Mode to Work by Race        Transit ## 4  Mode to Work by Race Worked at Home ## 5  Mode to Work by Race          Other ## 6  Mode to Work by Race           Auto ## 7  Mode to Work by Race   Bike or Walk ## 8  Mode to Work by Race        Transit ## 9  Mode to Work by Race Worked at Home ## 10 Mode to Work by Race          Other ## 11 Mode to Work by Race           Auto ## 12 Mode to Work by Race   Bike or Walk ## 13 Mode to Work by Race        Transit ## 14 Mode to Work by Race Worked at Home ## 15 Mode to Work by Race          Other # Static Chart          modes_chart <- static_bar_chart(t=mode_shares, y="Mode",x="share", fill="Year",                                     title="Mode Share to Work",                                     alt="Chart of Work Mode Shares",                                     source=paste("Source: ACS 5-Year Estimates, table B3002",                                                  "for King, Kitsap, Pierce and Snohomish counties.",                                                  sep = "\n"),                                     color="pgnobgy_5") modes_chart

title: Get Started Making a Static Plot
text: options saving static chart. First can right click plot open R-Studio save file. export static chart programmatically, can use ggplot2 function called ggsave: https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/ggsave.html can save static bar chart created programmatically.
code: ggsave(filename='modes_bar_chart.png', plot=modes_chart, device='png') ## Saving 7.29 x 4.51 in image

title: Get Started Making a Static Plot
text: psrcplot, provide many color ramps approved graphics department. color ramps can used referencing names color=“pgnobgy_5” . can see colors R following function: print_psrc_palette().
code: print_psrc_palette()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Craig Helmann. Maintainer. Christy Lam. Author. Megan Gryzbowski. Author. Suzanne Childress. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lam C, Gryzbowski M, Childress S (2023). psrcplot: Create PSRC consistent Data Visualization. R package version 0.1.0, https://psrc.github.io/psrcplot/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {psrcplot: Create PSRC consistent Data Visualization},   author = {Christy Lam and Megan Gryzbowski and Suzanne Childress},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://psrc.github.io/psrcplot/}, }

title: Create PSRC consistent Data Visualization
text: Package Creating PSRC consistent data visualizations R Install following command: devtools::install_github("psrc/psrcplot")

title: Create PSRC Line Chart — create.line.chart
text: function allows create line chart.

title: Create PSRC Line Chart — create.line.chart
code: create.line.chart(   t,   w.x,   w.y,   w.g,   w.title = NULL,   w.sub.title = NULL,   est.type = "number",   w.dec = 0,   x.type = "Date",   d.form = "%b-%Y",   w.breaks = NULL,   w.lwidth = 1,   w.color = "psrc_light",   w.interactive = "no" )

title: Create PSRC Line Chart — create.line.chart
text: t tibble dataframe long form plotting w.x name variable want plotted X-Axis w.y name variable want plotted Y-Axis w.g name variable want fill color lines based w.title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" w.sub.title Sub-title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" est.type Type Y values - enter "percent", "currency" "number", defaults "number" w.dec Number decimal points labels - defaults 0 x.type Type values X-Axis either "Continuous" "Date", defaults "Date" d.form Format Date values w.breaks Break points use using continuous scale, defaults NULL w.lwidth Width lines, defaults 1 w.color Name color palette use - defaults "psrc_light" w.interactive Enable hover text interactive features - defaults ""

title: Create PSRC Line Chart — create.line.chart
text: line chart

title: Create PSRC Bubble Chart — create_bubble_chart
text: function allows create bubble charts.

title: Create PSRC Bubble Chart — create_bubble_chart
code: create_bubble_chart(   t,   w.x,   w.y,   f,   s,   w.color = "psrc_light",   w.title = NULL,   w.sub.title = NULL )

title: Create PSRC Bubble Chart — create_bubble_chart
text: t tibble dataframe long form plotting w.x name variable want plotted X-Axis w.y name variable want plotted Y-Axis f name variable want fill color bubbles based s name variable used size bubbles w.color Name color palette use - defaults "psrc_light" w.title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" w.sub.title Sub-title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL"

title: Create PSRC Bubble Chart — create_bubble_chart
text: bubble chart

what: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
title: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
text: function allows create facet bar charts.

title: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
code: create_facet_bar_chart(   t,   w.x,   w.y,   f,   g,   w.moe = NULL,   est.type = "percent",   w.scales = "free",   w.facet = 3,   w.dec = 0,   l.pos = "above",   w.color = "psrc_dark",   w.title = NULL,   w.sub.title = NULL,   w.interactive = "no" )

title: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
text: t tibble dataframe long form plotting w.x name variable want plotted X-Axis w.y name variable want plotted Y-Axis f name variable want fill color bars based g name variable facets w.moe name variable used error bars, desired - default "NULL" est.type Type Y values - enter "percent", "currency" "number", defaults "percent" w.scales Value axis facets, either "fixed" "free" - defaults "free" w.facet Value number columns facet - defaults 3 w.dec Number decimal points labels - defaults 0 l.pos Position bar labels "" "within" - defaults "" w.color Name color palette use - defaults "psrc_dark" w.title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" w.sub.title Sub-title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" w.interactive Enable hover text interactive features - defaults ""

title: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
text: facet bar chart either static interactive depending choice

title: Create PSRC Facet Bar Charts — create_facet_bar_chart
code: library(dplyr) # Read in the example data and filter to 2020 Population by Race by County df <- read.csv(system.file('extdata', 'example_data.csv', package='psrcplot')) %>%        filter(Category=="Population by Race" & Year==2020) %>%       filter(Geography!="Region" & Race!="Total")  # Create a facet chart for population by race using counties as the facet my.chart <- create_facet_bar_chart(t=df, w.x="Race", w.y="share",                                     f="Race", g="Geography",                                     w.facet=2, w.scales="fixed")

title: Create PSRC TreeMap Chart — create_treemap_chart
text: function allows create treemap charts.

title: Create PSRC TreeMap Chart — create_treemap_chart
code: create_treemap_chart(   t,   w.area,   w.fill,   w.title = NULL,   w.sub.title = NULL,   est.type = "percent",   w.dec = 0,   w.color = "psrc_light" )

title: Create PSRC TreeMap Chart — create_treemap_chart
text: t tibble dataframe long form plotting w.area name variable thee value want use size bars w.fill name variable want fill bars w.title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" w.sub.title Sub-title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" est.type Type Y values - enter "percent", "currency" "number", defaults "percent" w.dec Number decimal points labels - defaults 0 w.color Name color palette use - defaults "psrc_light"

title: Create PSRC TreeMap Chart — create_treemap_chart
text: static treemap chart

title: Create PSRC TreeMap Chart — create_treemap_chart
code: library(dplyr)  # Read in the example data and filter to Mode to Work for Everyone for all years in the data df <- read.csv(system.file('extdata', 'example_data.csv', package='psrcplot')) %>%        filter(Category=="Mode to Work by Race") %>%       filter(Geography=="Region" & Race=="Total") %>%       mutate(Year = as.character(Year)) %>%       filter(Year=="2020")  my.chart <- create_treemap_chart(t=df, w.area="share", w.fill="Mode", w.title="Mode Share to Work")

what: Create an Interactive Bar Chart — interactive_bar_chart
title: Create an Interactive Bar Chart — interactive_bar_chart
text: function allows create bar charts (horizontal bars).

title: Create an Interactive Bar Chart — interactive_bar_chart
code: interactive_bar_chart(   t,   x,   y,   fill,   pos = "dodge",   est = "percent",   moe = NULL,   href = NULL,   hrefnm = NULL,   hrefcl = NULL,   title = NULL,   dec = 0,   color = "pgnobgy_5" )

title: Create an Interactive Bar Chart — interactive_bar_chart
text: t tibble long form plotting x name variable want plotted X-Axis y name variable want plotted Y-Axis fill name variable want fill color bars based pos Determines bars side--side(dodge) stacked(stack) - defaults "dodge" est Type Y values - enter "percent", "currency" "number", defaults "percent" moe name variable used error bars, desired - default "NULL" href list values used horizontal reference lines - default "NULL" hrefnm list names used horizontal reference lines equal length number lines - default "NULL" hrefcl list colors used horizontal reference lines equal length number lines - default "NULL" title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" dec Number decimal points labels - defaults 0 color Name color palette use - defaults "pgnobgy_5"

title: Create an Interactive Bar Chart — interactive_bar_chart
text: interactive bar (horizontal bar) chart

title: Create an Interactive Bar Chart — interactive_bar_chart
code: library(dplyr) library(stringr) mode_shares <- read.csv(system.file('extdata', 'example_data.csv', package='psrcplot')) %>%    filter(Category=="Mode to Work by Race") %>%   filter(Geography=="Region" & Race=="Total") %>%   mutate(Year = as.character(Year)) %>%   mutate(axis_labels = str_wrap(Mode, width = 10))  modes_bar_chart <- interactive_bar_chart(t=mode_shares, x="share", y="axis_labels", fill="Year",                                          est = "percent",                                          title="Mode Share to Work",                                          color="gnbopgy_5", dec = 0)

what: Create an Interactive Column Chart — interactive_column_chart
title: Create an Interactive Column Chart — interactive_column_chart
text: function allows create column charts (vertical bars).

title: Create an Interactive Column Chart — interactive_column_chart
code: interactive_column_chart(   t,   x,   y,   fill,   pos = "dodge",   est = "percent",   moe = NULL,   href = NULL,   hrefnm = NULL,   hrefcl = NULL,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   source = "",   alt = NULL,   dec = 0,   color = "pgnobgy_5" )

title: Create an Interactive Column Chart — interactive_column_chart
text: t tibble long form plotting x name variable want plotted X-Axis y name variable want plotted Y-Axis fill name variable want fill color bars based pos Determines bars side--side(dodge) stacked(stack) - defaults "dodge" est Type Y values - enter "percent", "currency" "number", defaults "percent" moe name variable used error bars, desired - default "NULL" href list values used horizontal reference lines - default "NULL" hrefnm list names used horizontal reference lines equal length number lines - default "NULL" hrefcl list colors used horizontal reference lines equal length number lines - default "NULL" title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" subtitle Sub-title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" source Source reference used chart, desired - defaults blank alt Text used alt-text, desired - defaults "NULL" dec Number decimal points labels - defaults 0 color Name color palette use - defaults "pgnobgy_5"

title: Create an Interactive Column Chart — interactive_column_chart
text: interactive column (vertical bar) chart

title: Interactive Line Chart — interactive_line_chart
text: function allows create line chart.

title: Interactive Line Chart — interactive_line_chart
code: interactive_line_chart(   t,   x,   y,   fill,   title = "",   est = "number",   dec = 0,   xtype = "Date",   dform = "%b-%Y",   breaks = NULL,   lwidth = 1,   color = "psrc_light" )

title: Interactive Line Chart — interactive_line_chart
text: t tibble dataframe long form plotting x name variable want plotted X-Axis y name variable want plotted Y-Axis fill name variable want fill color lines based title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" est Type Y values - enter "percent", "currency" "number", defaults "number" dec Number decimal points labels - defaults 0 xtype Type values X-Axis either "Continuous" "Date", defaults "Date" dform Format Date values breaks Break points use using continuous scale, defaults NULL lwidth Width lines, defaults 1 color Name color palette use - defaults "psrc_light"

title: Interactive Line Chart — interactive_line_chart
text: line chart

what: psrcplot: A package for easy creation of plots and maps for the Puget Sound Region. — psrcplot
title: psrcplot: A package for easy creation of plots and maps for the Puget Sound Region. — psrcplot
text: Various functions create charts, tables maps data Central Puget Sound Region. package currently development updated frequently last half 2022. Colors, fonts chart styles consistent design standards used PSRC.

title: psrcplot: A package for easy creation of plots and maps for the Puget Sound Region. — psrcplot
text: Craig Helmann chelmann@psrc.org

title: PSRC Color Palettes — psrc_colors
text: Available Options: "purples_inc", "oranges_inc", "greens_inc", "blues_inc", "grays_inc",    "purples_dec", "oranges_dec", "greens_dec", "blues_dec", "grays_dec",    "pognbgy_5", "pgnobgy_5", "gnbopgy_5", "obgnpgy_5",    "pognbgy_10", "pgnobgy_10", "gnbopgy_10", "obgnpgy_10",    "psrc_light", "psrc_dark", "psrc_pairs"

what: Create a Static Bar Chart — static_bar_chart
title: Create a Static Bar Chart — static_bar_chart
text: function allows create bar charts (horizontal bars).

title: Create a Static Bar Chart — static_bar_chart
code: static_bar_chart(   t,   x,   y,   fill,   pos = "dodge",   est = "percent",   moe = NULL,   href = NULL,   hrefnm = NULL,   hrefcl = NULL,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   source = "",   alt = NULL,   xlabel = NULL,   ylabel = NULL,   dec = 0,   color = "psrc_dark" )

title: Create a Static Bar Chart — static_bar_chart
text: t tibble long form plotting x name variable want plotted X-Axis y name variable want plotted Y-Axis fill name variable want fill color bars based pos Determines bars side--side(dodge) stacked(stack) - defaults "dodge" est Type Y values - enter "percent", "currency" "number", defaults "percent" moe name variable used error bars, desired - default "NULL" href list values used horizontal reference lines - default "NULL" hrefnm list names used horizontal reference lines equal length number lines - default "NULL" hrefcl list colors used horizontal reference lines equal length number lines - default "NULL" title Title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" subtitle Sub-title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" source Source reference used chart, desired - defaults blank alt Text used alt-text, desired - defaults "NULL" xlabel X-axis title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" ylabel Y-axis title used chart, desired - defaults "NULL" dec Number decimal points labels - defaults 0 color Name color palette use - defaults "psrc_dark"

title: Create a Static Bar Chart — static_bar_chart
text: static bar (horizontal bar) chart

title: Create a Static Bar Chart — static_bar_chart
code: library(dplyr) mode_shares <- read.csv(system.file('extdata', 'example_data.csv', package='psrcplot')) %>%   filter(Category=="Mode to Work by Race") %>%  filter(Geography=="Region" & Race=="Total") %>%  mutate(Year = as.character(Year))  # Static Chart          modes_chart <- static_bar_chart(t=mode_shares, y="Mode",x="share", fill="Year",                                     title="Mode Share to Work",                                     alt="Chart of Work Mode Shares",                                     source=paste("Source: ACS 5-Year Estimates, table B3002",                                                  "for King, Kitsap, Pierce and Snohomish counties.",                                                  sep = "\n"),                                     color="pgnobgy_5")

title: Create a Static Column Chart — static_column_chart
code: library(dplyr) mode_shares <- read.csv(system.file('extdata', 'example_data.csv', package='psrcplot')) %>%   filter(Category=="Mode to Work by Race") %>%  filter(Geography=="Region" & Race=="Total") %>%  mutate(Year = as.character(Year))  # Static Chart          modes_chart <- static_column_chart(t=mode_shares, x="Mode",y="share", fill="Year",                                     title="Mode Share to Work",                                     alt="Chart of Work Mode Shares",                                     source=paste("Source: ACS 5-Year Estimates, table B3002",                                                  "for King, Kitsap, Pierce and Snohomish counties.",                                                  sep = "\n"),                                     color="pgnobgy_5")
